intro: Conioselinum nepalense, commonly known as Nepal wormwood, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan regions of Nepal and northern India. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in umbels. Its leaves are usually finely divided and have a mild, aromatic scent. Conioselinum nepalense is often found in moist, mountainous habitats and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
